heading: Router configuration wizard
intro: This wizard helps to configure your Freifunk router.

offlineWarning.headline: No internet connection
offlineWarning.help: You don't seam to have an internet connection. Some features of this wizard need a connection. You could either connect your router to the internet or use the online version of this wizard with another connection, save the config file there and then apply it to your router

loadconfig.headline: Load configuration
loadconfig.hasconfiguration: I have an exisiting config file
loadconfig.help: If you already have a config file, you can load it. So you're able to update it or adapt it for other routers you want to set up.

upload.label: Your file
upload.drop: Drag your file here or click.
upload.dropnotsupported: Your browser doesn't support drag and drop for file uploads :(

routerName.label: Router name
routerName.help: The router name is a human-readable identifier for your router. The router name is used by various services in the Freifunk network. For example, if "Monitoring" is enabled, then the router name will be listed on http://monitor.berlin.freifunk.net along with many interesting statistics about your router. The router name is also used when other Freifunk routers in the area mesh with your router (OLSR). The router name is also shown on the Freifunk map.

password.label: New router password
password.error.minLength: A password must have at least 6 characters.

sshkeys.label: SSH keys
sshkeys.help: Enable this to add your ssh keys for passwordless root login to your router. SSH keys are helpful, if you maintain multiple routers or if you want to give access to a friend. If you don't know about ssh keys, simply ignore this setting

keys.label: Your keys
keys.help: Add your keys, each in a new line.
keys.invalidkey: One of your keys is invalid.

email.label: Email
email.help: Your email address will be shown on the contact page of your router. When people connect to the Freifunk network trough your router, they can then see the conact data on frei.funk. Your email address is required if VPN cert/key generation or IP registration is activated below.

error.required: A valid email address is required for the current configuration.
error.pattern: Please enter a valid email address.

contactPage.label: Show email on Contact Page
contactPage.help: Disable if you don't want your email address to be shown on the contact page (only visible within freifunk).

sendToMap.label: Send email address to map
sendToMap.help: Enable if you want your email address to be sent to the map (visible on the internet).

mailinglist.label: Mailing list
mailinglist.help: to the mailing list of Berlin's freifunk community. You can find more information on the list homepage.
mailinglist.helpoffline: Please visit the mailing list page of Berlin's freifunk community, when you're online again. There you can subscribe to that list.

routerLocation.headline: Router location
routerLocation.help: The geographic location of your router is used to place your router on the Freifunk map. You can drag the map marker to the correct location or enter the location and address manually.
routerLocation.offlineMsg: Your internet connections seems offline. Using the map only works when you're online. You can add your location manually or do that later.

internetSharing.headline: Internet sharing
internetSharing.help: Freifunk is an independent and free network built by many volunteers that can be used for many different purposes. One purpose is to access the internet and this service is only possible because some Freifunkas have decided to share their internet connections.

shareInternet.label: Share internet
shareInternet.help: If you want to share your internet connection select this checkbox.
shareInternet.thanks: Thank you for sharing your internet connection!

limitspeed.label: Limit speed
limitspeed.help: If you encounter speed problems with your internet connection, you can limit the speed you share to freifunk here. Our advice: start without any limits, you can adjust that later

transferSpeed.label: Transfer speed limit
transferSpeed.help: You can limit the transfer speed that the Freifunk network is able to use on your internet connection. You can determine your current transfer speed here. Leave the fields blank if you do not wish to limit the transfer speed.

antistoererhaftung.label: VPN (Anti-Störerhaftung)
antistoererhaftung.help: You can use a VPN to protect yourself from the Störerhaftung. If you agree that Störerhaftung is bad for free networks then you can help us to put an end to Störerhaftung!

generateCertificate.label: Generate VPN03 certificate and key for this router
generateCertificate.help: The Förderverein Freie Netzwerke operates the VPN03 servers for protecting yourself from the Störerhaftung. If this option is enabled, the wizard automatically generates a new certificate and key for VPN03. Disable this option if you already have a VPN03 config or if you want to use another VPN service (OpenVPN).
generateCertificate.certificate.label: VPN certificate
generateCertificate.key.label: VPN key
generateCertificate.conf.label: VPN configuration file
generateCertificate.error.required: The file is required. It is generated automatically if you select the checkbox above.

ip.headline: IP addresses
ip.help: Your router requires IP addresses for communicating with other routers and with clients that connect to the access point. Freifunk uses both IPv4 (legacy) and IPv6 (recent).

register.label: Register new IP addresses
register.help: If this option is enabled, the wizard automatically registers new IP addresses for this router. Disable only if you already have IP addresses from the Freifunk Berlin IP registry.

v6Prefix.label: IPv6 prefix
v6Prefix.help: The IPv6 prefix is used to automatically configure all network interfaces of this router.
v6Prefix.error.ipAddress: Please enter a valid IPv6 prefix.
v6Prefix.error.ipPrefixMaxLength: The IPv6 prefix length must not be larger than /62.

v4.error.ipSingle: You must provide a single IPv4 address.
v4.error.ipSubnetSmall: The IPv4 subnet must be larger than /30.

wifi.label: Wifi ({{name}}) Mesh-IPv4
wifi.help: A single IPv4 address for the wifi device {{name}}.

lan.label: LAN Mesh-IPv4
lan.help: A single IPv4 address for the LAN interface.

meshLan.help: Allows you to connect the LAN ports of your router via a cable to other devices that also have this setting enabled. If you only have one router, this setting can be turned off. Then the LAN ports can be used to connect clients with a cable.
meshLan.label: Mesh via LAN

distribute.label: Distribute client IP addresses
distribute.help: At least one router in your local mesh (specifically: the local BATMAN-adv mesh) should distribute IP addresses for clients. If you share your internet connection with this router or if are unsure if there is another router in your neighborhood that distributes IPs, you should enable this setting.

subnet.label: Client IPv4 subnet
subnet.error.pattern: This is not a valid subnet.
subnet.help: The IPv4 subnet from which IPs are distributed to clients that connect to your access point.

expectedClients.label: Expected number of concurrent clients
expectedClients.help: Please estimate how many clients will be connected to your access point at the same time.

error.required: This field is required unless you register new IPs automatically.
error.ipPattern: This is not a valid IP adress.

monitoring.headline: Monitoring
monitoring.show: If you want your router to send data to the monitoring services, check that box! If your router is weak (slow CPU, low RAM, low flash memory, i.e. TP-Link 841n), you should not enable monitoring
monitoring.label: Enable Monitoring
monitoring.help: The Freifunk community of berlin provides a monitoring service. We collect information about transfer speeds, memory and CPU statistics, network connections. It is public available at http://monitoring.berlin.freifunk.net. Monitoring helps community members to analyze network problems.

advancedWifi.headline: Advanced wifi options
advancedWifi.help: By default your router is configured to connect automatically with other Freifunk routers that also have default settings. If you want to connect to a router with a special configuration, you can pick this router from a wifi scan or you can enter the configuration manually.
advancedWifi.channel.label: Channel

filter.label: Filter SSID by
filter.noresult: No scan results match the filter {{filter}}!

configIncorrect: The data you entered is invalid. Please correct the fields marked with before you continue.
